Welcome to Concordia International!

Concordia University today aims for a distinct international profile in all areas of research and education. Building on Concordia’s multicultural, diverse and open character, Concordia International will provide leadership to affirm the University’s respected presence in international networking development, crossing barriers to expand the notion of active and collaborative learning opportunities at all levels, towards a ‘university without borders’.

International Students Office

 
 



If you are interested in International Student Admissions, we invite you to link to the following site: Future International Students. You can also get admission information at Connect2Concordia.

The International Students Office is your main resource centre on campus. Many international students call the ISO their "home away from home." Hopefully, with time, you will become familiar with our office and our staff, and will also feel like calling it "home".

Our mandate is to facilitate your adaptation at Concordia University, and our ultimate goal is to make sure that you have a successful academic and personal experience with us. Come and meet our friendly staff.

concordia international students association (cisa)

CISA offers services to all international students. Effort is put into helping new students adjust to Concordia, Montreal and Canada in every possible way.


They went through the same things when they arrived. After a few days with them you will feel right at home.


Activities include a tour of Montreal in September, trips to different parts of the country, winter activities, parties and dinners. Major cultural and athletic events are also organized to help you represent your culture and meet international students from other Canadian universities.


If you would like to get in touch with them, or have questions, visit the web site and register as a CISA member at: http://www.cisa-concordia.com

Ethics and Compliance Related Policies

Research Involving Human Subjects

  • Concordia University Policy for the Ethical Review of Research Involving Humans
  • Procedures for the Ethical Review of Research Involving Humans
  • Concordia University Policy for the Inquiry and Investigation of Allegations of Research Misconduct
  • Procedures for the Inquiry and Investigation of Allegations of Research Misconduct
  • TCPS 2—2nd edition of Tri-Council Policy Statement: Ethical Conduct for Research Involving Humans
  • EPTC 2 — 2e édition de l'Énoncé de politique des trois Conseils : Éthique de la recherche avec des êtres humains
  • The TCPS 2 Tutorial: Course on Research Ethics (CORE)
  • Le didacticiel EPTC 2 : Formation en éthique de la recherche (FER)
  • Memorandum of Understanding (MOU): Agreement between the three federal granting agencies and every Canadian university, describing the basic requirements for obtaining and maintaining institutional eligibility to administer agency funds. Concordia signed in September 2002.
  • Online Ethics Training Tutorial offered by the National Institutes of Health (NIH): “Human Participant Protections Education for Research Teams.” An overview of some of the fundamental ethical principles of the protection of human participants, including historical background and case studies.
  • Inter-Agency Advisory Panel on Research Ethics (PRE). Advises on the development, evolution, interpretation and implementation of the TCPS.
  • National Council on Ethics in Human Research (NCEHR). Among other things, hosts a listserv discussing questions of policy and practice relating to research ethics, and a directory of Canadian research ethics boards (REBs).

Research Involving Animals

  • Canadian Council on Animal Care (CCAC)

International internships

Concordia students

Are you interested in studying overseas? Concordia International supports several programs that give you the opportunity to add an international flavour to your student experience.

Learn more about our programs

Students visiting Concordia as research trainees

Each year, Concordia’s departments and research centres welcome research trainees from around the world to collaborate on university research projects. International students interested in applying for an internship should review the university's policy on academic visitors to see if they meet the criteria.

Learn more about internships at Concordia for international students

Visiting faculty & researchers

Faculty exchanges foster research partnerships, stregthen our programs, establish networks and offer worldwide opportunities to colleagues.

We welcome visiting scholars from around the world. Similarly, Concordia faculty are open to visiting other universities for teaching or research opportunities.

Visiting faculty

Scholars interested in visiting Concordia can visit Concordia International for more information.

Concordia faculty visiting abroad

Concordia faculty who are interested in an exchange can visit Concordia Interantional for more information.

Exchange programs

Concordia's International Exchange Program allows you to study abroad and get credit towards your Concordia degree, while paying the same tuition fees you do at home.

Discover the types of exchange programs, where you can study, sources of funding and how to apply on the Concordia International website.

Where can I go?

All over the world! Concordia University has two types of exchange agreements: bilateral and CRÉPUQ. This means a ton of options for you. See the full list of places you can go!  

Students interested in studying at an institution that does not have an exchange agreement with Concordia may still be granted permission to do so. In this situation, students would be required to pay tuition directly to their host university.

How do I apply?

To receive permission to go on a student exchange, students should refer to the exchange program procedure before completing an application form.

Can I get funding?

While you’re on exchange, you remain a Concordia student and are eligible for Concordia awards, scholarship and financial assistance. In addition, you might be eligible to receive up to $1,000 per month free bursary from the Québec government. Visit the Funding Opportunities section for additional information.

International students

Concordia welcomes applicants from all parts of Canada, the United States and abroad. The university’s international students, who hail from more than 150 different countries, make up nearly 12 per cent of the 38,809 for-credit students.

Programs & courses

Concordia provides a wide range of innovative programs and courses that offer a unique and rewarding educational experience. Concordia boasts small classes, accessible professors, and an affordable education. Explore: 

  • 300 undergraduate programs. Bachelors and certificate degrees, which are offered by four faculties, include opportunities for cross-faculty studies.
  • More than 100 graduate programs that lead to master's, doctoral, diploma and certificate degrees, delivered by the four faculties and the School of Graduate Studies.
  • A wide range of non-credit programs, including intensive English-language and professional certificate programs, offered by the Centre for Continuing Education


Bustling campus life

Discover our campus by exploring campus life or booking a campus tour.

Montreal is both an exciting place and affordable city. The majority of students opt for off-campus housing, while others live with roommates, family or on their own, or on-campus residences. Find out more about housing for new undergraduate students.

 

International Students Office

Concordia recognizes that individuals from different cultures and educational systems have differing needs. The International Student Office (ISO) staff members provide students with services in a warm and welcoming environment.

The ISO is the first stop for all international students. Most international students consider the ISO as their home away from home. Staff members are highly knowledgeable and ready available to field questions or, if need be, make referrals on how to respond to queries.

ISO services include:

  • Advising and support
  • Orientation and information sessions
  • * Assistance with immigration documents (i.e., CAQs and study permits)
  • Assistance with academic and para-academic problems and emergencies, and immigration matters
  • Issuing short-term emergency loans
  • Information on employment regulations
  • Acting as a liaison with sponsoring agencies and governmental sponsors
  • Help with handling health-insurance plans for international students
  • Housing support groups to inform new students about availabilities in Montreal
  • The ISO information bulletin

* It is mandatory for international students to submit their immigration documents to the ISO at the beginning of the term.

The International Students Office also publishes important resources:

Pre-Departure Guide for International Students: This booklet contains step-by-step procedures on how to obtain the proper immigration documents to study in Quebec and Canada. It includes information about finances, housing, tuition and health insurance. Download the Pre-Departure Guide for International Students.

The International Student Handbook: Contains information for international students about living in Montreal and services available at Concordia. Returning international students may also find recent information about policies and regulations that affect all international students. Download the International Student Handbook(PDF).

More about the International Students Office.

Concordia International Students Association

The Concordia International Students Association, run by and for international students and those with an interest in cultural diversity, helps international students adjust to life at Concordia, as well as in Montreal and Quebec.

International

To take on the planet's big problems, you have to look beyond borders. Students from 150 countries energize our campus. Faculty conduct research around the world and our classrooms bustle with visiting scholars. Want to experience the world up close? Discover countless study exchanges, volunteer projects, alternative spring breaks, and internships.

International admissions
Interested in studying at Concordia? You could be one of the more than 5,000 current students here who come from overseas.
Learn about international admissions
Exchange programs
If you want to see the world through fresh eyes, spend time in another country. We offer exchanges with 33 countries around the world.
Explore student exchange options
International Students Office
The International Students Office is your main resource centre on campus. Many international students call it their "home away from home."
Get in touch with us
International internships
Do work related to your studies in another country. We'll tell you how Concordia students can do internships abroad, and how international students can do internships here.
Discover international internship options
Global alumni
Enthusiastic alumni keep our 24 international alumni chapters strong from London to New York to Beijing and beyond.
Connect with international alumni
Visiting faculty & researchers
Come to Concordia to do research, or investigate teaching abroad on exchange for a year.

Strategic research plan

Concordia seeks to foster a vibrant and supportive research environment that values the very diverse nature of all research done by Concordia faculty. It does so through its internal funding programs as well as through strategic level investments. The university's Canada Research Chairs (CRC) and Canada Foundation for Innovation (CFI) Strategic Research Plan seeks to further mobilize excellence in our major areas of research strength by building on established and emerging areas of critical mass where additional investment is required in order to maintain or build capacity. The plan was informed by internal policies and an analysis of Concordia's major research strengths.

Research Chairs

Concordia University recognizes and values the role played by Research Chairs (“Chairholders”) in creating and mobilizing knowledge with the aim of achieving research excellence. As leaders in their fields, Chairholders play a critical role in deepening our knowledge base and in strengthening our teaching, the training of highly qualified personnel, and research capacity. As catalysts and builders, they contribute to the university's positioning in given areas of scholarly pursuit and to the enhancement of the research training environment.

Research units

By providing a stimulating and collaborative environment, research units contribute significantly to the university's academic life in terms of research output, visibility and overall positioning. The university houses a large number of research units, centres, institutes, groups, platforms, etc. Some are established organizations with significant intellectual property and critical masses of research capacity while others are temporary groups that are formed for a specific project. Research units complement the university’s academic department structure and provide unique training opportunities for students.

Partnerships and innovation

At Concordia, help is available for securing research partnership opportunities and agreements, negotiating research contracts, and ensuring compliance with its intellectual property policies. The university fosters and facilitates close collaboration with global knowledge communities in higher education and industry.

From lab to market

Concordia helps researchers access commercial markets through Valeo, a limited partnership formed in 2000. The university also publishes lists of available technologies, informs researchers about technology transfer issues and provides support.

Research contracts

The research partnerships & innovation unit assists Concordia's research community in securing funded research contracts and industrial partnership opportunities governed by agencies within both the private and public sectors.

Research exchange

Concordia leverages national and international partnerships to allow its researchers to fully participate in cross-pollination of ideas among public and private organizations, interest groups and educational institutions.

Open access

Accessibility to research and creative work is at the heart of Concordia's mission. Concordia is the first major university in Canada in which faculty members overwhelmingly support making the full results of their research universally available.

Featured partnership

Valeo

Valeo Management L.P., a limited partnership that began in 2000, is aimed at commercializing the results of research conducted by Concordia University and six universities affiliated with the Université du Québec network.

Opportunities for students

Concordia's research training occurs at all levels of the higher education spectrum. Undergraduate research opportunities range from honours theses projects to summer jobs. More than 100 graduate programs are complemented by a host of postdoctoral fellowship opportunities and a rich spectrum of collaborative research and training through our many centres and institutes.

Undergraduate research

Learn more about the undergraduate funding opportunities currently available, or browse through some of the Concordia-related research projects you can join. For additional funding options or to find topic-specific research project opportunities, please consult the website of the faculty, department or program you are interested in.

Graduate studies

Concordia's 100+ graduate programs span a diverse range of fields across the arts, humanities, natural and social sciences, engineering, commerce and administration, as well as interdisciplinary studies. The university supports highly specialized, field-specific research and is also a world leader in trans-disciplinary studies and training. These programs' intellectual vitality can be felt in our labs, classrooms, studios and corridors.

Postdoctoral Fellows

Postdoctoral Fellows, an integral part of the university community, make an indelible contribution to furthering its mission. As research trainees, Postdoctoral Fellows also have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to their chosen fields.

International programs

Building on a strong foundation of international academic cooperation, Concordia International focuses on developing and maintaining the growing interest in international educational opportunities. Many of our students and faculty members have helped create projects involving study-abroad programs, collaborative curriculum development and cutting-edge research.

Featured Postdoctoral Fellowship

Simone de Beauvoir Institute

The Simone de Beauvoir Institute welcomes Postdoctoral Fellows who are interested in studying feminist issues. The institute provides office space, internet access, library privileges, and a community of scholars committed to feminist inquiry.

Resources for researchers

The Office of Research supports Concordia's researchers through the funding cycle.

Research facilitators

Research facilitators collaborate with researchers in the faculties to seek targeted funding opportunities and review and develop applications.

Funding opportunities

Find information on internal funding opportunities, offered by the Vice-President, Research and Graduate Studies, and external funding opportunities. Information about fellowships, awards and prizes is also available.

Ethics, policies and compliance

Concordia is committed to ensuring the ethical integrity of all research done under its auspices, as well as compliance with regulatory bodies and university policies. Learn about the university's ethical compliance guidelines for research involving humans and animals or hazardous materials, and consult a comprehensive list of general policies.

Featured service

Environmental Health and Safety Office

The university's mission to integrate heath and safety into the research workplace is advanced by the Environmental Health and Safety Office, which provides support toward certifications, health and safety training, hazardous waste management and health and safety guidelines.
